body: and when I say "gratuitous one-off, contrary-to-documented" behavior, I would be glad to be proved wrong. I just don't think the conversation thus far on this issue has demonstrated that it's not a gratuitous deviation from documented behavior. Maybe it's the search for that answer that will bring about a satisfactory closing of this issue. Or, maybe it is what I think it is, and should be fixed to support calling the same way other Cgo functions can be called.
